resources.string: This optimization can be disabled by the regex flag "Raw Number".
When enabled, the rule only applies when both number and content match.

- Reject:
  Same as pressing the decline button. It works completely silently, lockscreen won\'t be turned on.

- Silence:
  It will ring silently in the background, giving the impression to the caller that you were unavailable and missed the call.

  It may also help if you are experiencing repeated spam calls, it will extend the call duration, making it less efficient for spammers, potentially discouraging them from calling you again.

- Answer and Hang Up:
  To avoid being sent to the voicemail. The lockscreen can be turned on for a short while, you might also hear a call end tone(some phones offer an option to mute this sound).

Dialed numbers will be allowed.

Sending message also counts, this only works when READ_SMS permission is granted.

The default setting 3 Days means if you have dialed or sent messages to the number within the past 3 days, calls from that number will be allowed.

Only applies to calls, not to text messages.

Priority: 10

Any call would pass if any app in the list has been used recently.

A typical use case:
  You just ordered a pizza in PizzaApp, soon they call you to refund because they are closing. That call would pass if PizzaApp is enabled here.

The default setting 5 Min means any call would pass if any of the apps has been used within 5 minutes, by `used` it means either being activated, deactivated, minimized, or killed.

Only applies to calls, not to text messages.

Priority: 10
